body_text:
I swear this used to be the recommended style in ant-design's docs, but looking again, they name the wrapped component WrappedThing instead.
I went with what I thought was their style because having a default import named CreateExtensionPage as well as a member import named CreateExtensionPage that are in fact two different things is confusing; if you import both in, say, a test, you end up naming the default import something different than what the rest of the app calls it. Having a special name for the unwrapped non-default export gets around this.
I'm not partial to the underscore; UnwrappedCreateExtensionPage, UnconnectedCreateExtensionPage, or whatever else you or @rehandalal want is equally fine.
body:
I swear this used to be the recommended style in ant-design's docs, but looking again, they name the wrapped component `WrappedThing` instead.

I went with what I thought was their style because having a default import named `CreateExtensionPage` as well as a member import named `CreateExtensionPage` that are in fact two different things is confusing; if you import both in, say, a test, you end up naming the default import something different than what the rest of the app calls it. Having a special name for the unwrapped non-default export gets around this.

I'm not partial to the underscore; `UnwrappedCreateExtensionPage`, `UnconnectedCreateExtensionPage`, or whatever else you or @rehandalal want is equally fine.
body_html:
I swear this used to be the recommended style in ant-design's docs, but looking again, they name the wrapped component WrappedThing instead.

I went with what I thought was their style because having a default import named CreateExtensionPage as well as a member import named CreateExtensionPage that are in fact two different things is confusing; if you import both in, say, a test, you end up naming the default import something different than what the rest of the app calls it. Having a special name for the unwrapped non-default export gets around this.

I'm not partial to the underscore; UnwrappedCreateExtensionPage, UnconnectedCreateExtensionPage, or whatever else you or @rehandalal want is equally fine.
